member.name: T:ARCed.Scintilla.INativeScintilla
member.summary:
Interface representing the native Scintilla Message Based API. In addition to wrappers around each of the messages I have included an additional Method named SendMessageDirect with 9 overloads. This allows you to send messages to the Scintilla DefWndProc bypassing Windows' SendMessage. Each of the other methods wrap calls to SendMessageDirect.
Scintilla explicetly implements this interface. To use these methods on a Scintilla control Cast it as INativeScintilla or use NativeScintilla property.
The reason for this interface is to keep the "regular" interface surface area of the Scintilla control as clean and .NETish as possible. Also this means when you want a direct native interface there's no other absracted members (Aside from SendMessageDirect ;) cluttering the native interface.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AnnotationCollection.StyleOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset applied to style indexes used in annotations.
member.returns: The offset applied to style indexes used in annotations.
member.remarks: Annotation styles may be completely separated from standard text styles by setting a style offset. For example, a value of 512 would shift the range of possible annotation styles to be from 512 to 767 so they do not overlap with standard text styles. This adjustment is applied automatically when setting or calling so the offset should NOT be manually factored in by the caller. This property is provided to maintain architectural symmetry with the native Scintilla component but is an advanced feature and typically should never need to be changed.

member.name: T:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol
member.summary: Specifies the symbol displayed by a .

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Circle
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a circle.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.RoundRectangle
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a rect with rounded edges.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Arrow
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a triangle pointing right. This symbol is typically used to mark a closed folder.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.SmallRect
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a horizontal rect.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.ShortArrow
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a small arrow pointing right.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Empty
member.summary: The marker has no visible glpyh. This symbol can still be used, however, to mark and track lines.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.ArrowDown
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a triangle pointing down. This symbol is typically used to mark an open folder.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Minus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a minus sign. This symbol is typically used to mark an open folder.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Plus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a plus sign. This symbol is typically used to mark a closed folder.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.VLine
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a vertical line. This symbol is typically used to mark nested lines of an open folder.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.LCorner
member.summary: The marker is drawn as straight lines intersecting in an "L" shape. This symbol is typically used to mark the end of a folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.TCorner
member.summary: The marker is drawn as straight lines intersecting in a rotated "T" shape. This symbol is typically used to mark the end of a nested folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.BoxPlus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a plus sign surrounded by a rect. This symbol is typically used to mark a closed folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.BoxPlusConnected
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a plus sign surrounded by a rect and vertial lines. This symbol is typically used to mark a nested closed folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.BoxMinus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a minus sign surrounded by a rect and a vertical line at the bottom. This symbol is typically used to mark an open folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.BoxMinusConnected
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a minus sign surrounded by a rect and vertical lines. This symbol is typically used to mark a nested open folder in a "box style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.LCornerCurve
member.summary: The marker is drawn as curved lines intersecting in an "L" shape. This symbol is typically used to mark the end of a folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.TCornerCurve
member.summary: The marker is drawn as curved lines intersecting in a rotated "T" shape. This symbol is typically used to mark the end of a nested folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.CirclePlus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a plus sign surrounded by a circle. This symbol is typically used to mark a closed folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.CirclePlusConnected
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a plus sign surrounded by a circle and vertial lines. This symbol is typically used to mark a nested closed folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.CircleMinus
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a minus sign surrounded by a circle and a vertical line at the bottom. This symbol is typically used to mark an open folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.CircleMinusConnected
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a minus sign surrounded by a circle and vertical lines. This symbol is typically used to mark a nested open folder in a "circle style" tree.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Background
member.summary: The marker has no visible glyph, however, the background color of the entire text line is drawn as specified in the property.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Ellipsis
member.summary: This marker is drawn as three horizontal dots.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Arrows
member.summary: The marker is drawn as three consecutive greater than glyphs.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.PixMap
member.summary: The marker is drawn using the image specified in the method.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.FullRectangle
member.summary: The marker has no visible glyph, however, the margin background color is draw as specified in the property.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.LeftRectangle
member.summary: The marker is drawn as a thick vertical line along the left edge of the margin.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Available
member.summary: The marker has no visible glyph, however, it can be used to signify to a plugin that the marker is available for a custom purpose.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.MarkerSymbol.Underline
member.summary: The marker has no visible glyph, however, the entire text line is drawn with an underline in the color specified by the property.

member.name: T:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo

member.name: M:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.BringIntoView
member.summary: Places the caret somewhere within the document that is displayed in the Scintilla Window
member.remarks: If the caret is already visible in the current scrolled view this method does nothing.

member.name: M:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.ChooseCaretX
member.summary: Scintilla remembers the x value of the last position horizontally moved to explicitly by the user and this value is then used when moving vertically such as by using the up and down keys. This method sets the current x position of the caret as the remembered value.

member.remarks: If the anchor position is less than the Caret Position it acts as the _start of the selection.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.BlinkRate
member.summary: Gets/Sets the time interval in milliseconds that the caret should blink.
member.remarks: This defaults to the system default value.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.Color
member.summary: Gets/Sets the color of the Caret.
member.remarks: Defaults to black

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.CurrentLineBackgroundAlpha

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.HighlightCurrentLine

member.remarks: determines the color.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.CaretInfo.IsSticky
member.summary: Controls when the last position of the caret on the line is saved. When set to true, the position is not saved when you type a character, a tab, paste the clipboard content or press backspace
member.remarks: Defaults to false

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.CancelAtStart
member.summary: The default behavior is for the list to be cancelled if the caret moves before the location it was at when the list was displayed. By setting this property to false, the list is not cancelled until the caret moves before the first character of the word being completed.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.DropRestOfWord

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.FillUpCharacters
member.summary: List of characters (no separated) that causes the AutoComplete window to accept the current selection.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.ImageSeparator
member.summary: Autocompletion list items may display an _srcTexture as well as text. Each _srcTexture is first registered with an integer type. Then this integer is included in the text of the list separated by a '?' from the text. For example, "fclose?2 fopen" displays _srcTexture 2 before the string "fclose" and no _srcTexture before "fopen".

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.MaxWidth
member.summary: Get or set the maximum width of an autocompletion list expressed as the number of characters in the longest item that will be totally visible.
member.remarks: If zero (the default) then the list's width is calculated to fit the item with the most characters. Any items that cannot be fully displayed within the available width are indicated by the presence of ellipsis.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.SelectedText
member.summary: Gets or Sets the Text of the currently selected AutoComplete item.
member.remarks: When setting this property it does not change the text of the currently selected item. Instead it searches the list for the given value and selects that item if it matches.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.AutoComplete.SingleLineAccept
member.summary: If you set this value to true and a list has only one item, it is automatically added and no list is displayed. The default is to display the list even if there is only a single item.

member.summary: The flags that are stored along with the fold level.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldLevel.Base
member.summary: The base value for a 0-level fold. The fold level is a number in the range 0 to 4095 (NumberMask). However, the initial fold level is set to Base(1024) to allow unsigned arithmetic on folding levels.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldLevel.WhiteFlag
member.summary: WhiteFlag indicates that the line is blank and allows it to be treated slightly different then its level may indicate. For example, blank lines should generally not be fold points and will be considered part of the preceding section even though they may have a lesser fold level.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldLevel.HeaderFlag
member.summary: HeaderFlag indicates that the line is a header (fold point).

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldLevel.BoxHeaderFlag
member.summary: Not documented by current Scintilla docs - associated with the removed Box fold style?

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldLevel.NumberMask
member.summary: A bit-mask indicating which bits are used to store the actual fold level.

member.name: T:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag
member.summary: The flags affecting how the fold is marked in the main text area (as well as in the margin). If the value changes for onscreen text, the display will redraw.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.LineBeforeExpanded
member.summary: A line is drawn above the text if the fold is expanded.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.LineBeforeContracted
member.summary: A line is drawn above the text if the fold is collapsed.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.LineAfterExpanded
member.summary: A line is drawn below the text if the fold is expanded.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.LineAfterContracted
member.summary: A line is drawn below the text if the fold is collapsed.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.LevelNumbers
member.summary: Display hexadecimal fold levels in line margin to aid debugging of folding. The appearance of this feature may change in the future.

member.name: F:ARCed.Scintilla.FoldFlag.Box
member.summary: Experimental feature that has been removed.

member.summary: Manages Document Navigation, which is a snapshot history of movements within a document.

member.summary: Causes the current position to navigate to the last snapshotted document position.

member.name: M:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.NavigateForward
member.summary: After 1 or more backwards navigations this command navigates to the previous backwards navigation point.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.BackwardStack
member.summary: List of entries that allow you to navigate backwards.
member.remarks: The ForwardStack and BackwardStack can be shared between multiple ARCed.Scintilla objects. This is useful in MDI applications when you wish to have a shared document navigation that remembers positions in each document.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.CanNavigateBackward
member.summary: Returns true if ARCed.Scintilla can perform a successful backward navigation.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.CanNavigateForward
member.summary: Returns true if ARCed.Scintilla can perform a successful forward navigation.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.ForewardStack
member.summary: List of entries that allow you to navigate forwards.
member.remarks: The ForwardStack and BackwardStack can be shared between multiple ARCed.Scintilla objects. This is useful in MDI applications when you wish to have a shared document navigation that remembers positions in each document.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether Document Navigation is tracked. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:ARCed.Scintilla.DocumentNavigation.MaxHistorySize
member.summary: Maximum number of places the document navigation remembers. Defaults to 50.

member.name: T:ARCed.Scintilla.TextModifiedEventArgs
member.summary: Provices data for the TextModified event
member.remarks: TextModifiedEventHandler is used as an abstracted subset of the SCN_MODIFIED notification message. It's used whenever the SCNotification's modificationType flags are SC_MOD_INSERTTEXT ,SC_MOD_DELETETEXT, SC_MOD_BEFOREINSERT and SC_MOD_BEFORE_DELETE. They all use a TextModifiedEventArgs which corresponds to a subset of the SCNotification struct having to do with these modification types.
